definition: round/lump/ball/to roll into a ball/to gather/regiment/group/society/classifier for a lump or a soft mass: wad (of paper), ball (of wool), cloud (of smoke)

sentences.english: While meeting financial group influence in foreign hotel to press on to the border, is because"wolf" come.
sentences.chinese: 在遇到外來飯店財團勢力壓境時，是因爲“狼”來了。

sentences.english: The push was modeled in part on how South Korean companies, known as chaebols, expanded in earlier years.
sentences.chinese: 這一作法部分仿效韓國財團企業早些年的擴張方式。

sentences.english: Is the tea party a real populist movement or a front for big business?
sentences.chinese: 它是一次平民運動，還是有大財團在暗中支持？

sentences.english: Mitsubishi conglomerate sells frozen stockpiles at tenfold previous prices.
sentences.chinese: 三棱財團以此前十倍價格出售其冷凍產品。

sentences.english: Stiftung mainly present itself in continental law system.
sentences.chinese: 財團法人制度主要存在於大陸法系。

sentences.english: The corporate-controlled media is flooding every outlet with anti-Iranian propaganda right now.
sentences.chinese: 財團控制的媒體正在想盡一切辦法搞反伊宣傳。

sentences.english: In fact, the economy had been bolstered for years by overinvestment by its chaebols, or industrial conglomerates.
sentences.chinese: 事實上，多年來支撐經濟的都是工業財團的過度投資。

sentences.english: Find the Consortium Quartermaster, sell junk and repair.
sentences.chinese: 尋找財團軍需官，賣破爛物並且修理。

sentences.english: Since bigger firms were not prepared to give it their backing, the project was foredoomed to failure.
sentences.chinese: 由於大財團不打算支持，這項計劃肯定要失敗的。

sentences.english: The bureaucracy guided national policy, and big business implemented technology and export strategies.
sentences.chinese: 政府官僚指導國家政策，大財團實施技術和出口策略。

sentences.english: The BP consortium can rely on the experience of CNPC.
sentences.chinese: 英國石油爲首的財團可以依靠中石油的經驗。

sentences.english: Huang is backed by one of the wealthiest investment funds in Asia.
sentences.chinese: 文章稱，黃建華背後有亞洲大財團的支持。

sentences.english: The Inagawa no longer work for Bush, the boss added.
sentences.chinese: 這位稻川老闆補充說稻川財團不再爲布什集團工作。

sentences.english: Public enterprises or incorporated foundations receiving donations from the government.
sentences.chinese: 公營事業或接受政府捐助之財團法人。

sentences.english: We’re in this mess because of big business and Wall Street.
sentences.chinese: 我們陷入現在的換亂處境完全拜大財團和華爾街所賜。

sentences.english: We need to make sure our collective voices talk louder.
sentences.chinese: 我們民衆要確保我們的集體聲音響過這些大財團。

definition: merger and acquisition (M and A)/acquisition/to take over
to purchase (from various places)/to acquire (a company)
developer (of real estate, a commercial product etc)
property/real estate/abbr. for 物業管理|物业管理[wu4 ye4 guan3 li3], property management
to inject funds/to put money into (the market)
tycoon/magnate/big player (including company, country, school etc)/big shot
